PRESIDENT
SEYMOUR N. SIEGEL
WNYC, Municipal Broadcasting System
2500 Municipal Building
New York 7, N. Y.
Mr* James Miles
119 Gregory Hall
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
November 18, 195>2
Obu^
Dear Jims . !^J
Thanks for your letter of November li; in reply ^ v ,
to my request for information, I shall look forward to X ^*y
receiving the minutes of the meeting at your very earliest^
convenience. There were a number of matters which the
new president was to take care of which should be handled
soon - such as a note to Griffith accepting the offer of
the funds for the seminar - so I shall look forward to
hearing from youThe purpose of this note is to con¬
gratulate you upon the new January, 195>3 schedule of NAEB
releases. To my way of thinking, this is the most intelli¬
gent, most varied, most interesting and most significant
line-up of shows we have placed on the net since we began
operations. I would suggest a national release to all
of the papers in the NAEB member station areas headlining
these programs.
The mimeographed note you received from me a day
or two ago answers your question of combining the strategy
meeting with the FAE meeting in Chicago. I have written
Paulu and Smythe regar^.ng the possibility of a meeting
of our NAEB-NUEi^ofiyouP campus the night of December 2
and the morning of December 3. I trust you will be avail¬
able for that meeting also and I hope you will give
Wilbur a buzz and tell him that I hope to see him some
time on the 3rd if he is in town. I expect to get out
of Urbana for Chicago on the afternoon of the 3rd to be
in Chicago for a conference with two or three people on
the evening of the 3rd prior to the work of December U.
Dallas is taking care of room reservations for Morton
and me and I have asked Burton to communicate with Dallas
concerning his wishes*
DIRECTOR OF STUDIES
DALLAS W. SMYTHE
Illinois University Communica¬
tions Research Institute.
Urbana, Illinois
